channel.title: Help client crashes!
channel.description:
hi im using windows 64bit and i wanna play on my friends server but everytime click twice ingame it crashes and heres the client code
[code=c]@echo off cd Client Files "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause[/code]

item.title: Help client crashes!
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

[quote=“AustenGreen, post:7, topic:378312”][quote]Why does it say “Client Files”, is that what the actual file directory is named? If not, that could be why it isn’ t running.
[/quote]
“cd Client files” is changing directory it loads with for example if your batch is in a diffrent location than the files it uses to load you’d add it in kinda like this

@echo off cd C:\Documents and Settings\Green's\Desktop\Client V1.01 "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause
in witch “C:\Documents and Settings\Green’s\Desktop\Client V1.01” is where your client class, jframe class is all located…[/quote]

No shit, I already knew that. I was asking if the folder was actually named “Client Files”.

Read full topic

item.title: Help client crashes!
item.dc:creator: @AustenGreen AustenGreen
item.description:
@AustenGreen wrote:

Why does it say "Client Files", is that what the actual file directory is named? If not, that could be why it isn' t running.
"cd Client files" is changing directory it loads with for example if your batch is in a diffrent location than the files it uses to load you'd add it in kinda like this

@echo off cd C:\Documents and Settings\Green's\Desktop\Client V1.01 "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause
in witch “C:\Documents and Settings\Green’s\Desktop\Client V1.01” is where your client class, jframe class is all located…

====================================================================================================

if you guys where smart at all… then ud use this:

@echo off cd Client Files "C:\Program Files (x64)\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause

or

@echo off cd Client Files "C:\Program Files (x64)\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause

or

@echo off cd Client Files "C:\Program Files (x64)\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause

Read full topic
